name: Verona
fun_fact: Fun fact: Verona's Arena, a perfectly preserved Roman amphitheater built in 30 AD, hosts the world's largest opera festival under the stars - seating 15,000 spectators where gladiators once fought.

hero_dishes.name: Risotto all'Amarone
hero_dishes.description: Creamy Vialone Nano rice cooked in rich Amarone wine from Valpolicella, creating a deep burgundy risotto with complex, fruity notes
hero_dishes.origin_story: This dish celebrates two of Verona's protected specialties: Vialone Nano PGI rice grown in the plains around Verona, and Amarone wine from the nearby Valpolicella hills. The rice absorbs the prestigious wine, creating a luxurious marriage of local terroir.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Antica Bottega del Vino (1500s wine bar with 18,000+ wine labels), Ostregheteria Sottoriva 23, Caffe Dante Bistrot (a Veronese institution since the 1860s)

hero_dishes.name: Pastissada de Caval
hero_dishes.description: Tender horse meat stew slow-cooked in red wine with aromatic herbs, creating a rich, deeply flavorful dish
hero_dishes.origin_story: Born during the siege of Verona (569-572 AD) when Lombard King Alboino's horses fell in battle. The locals, desperate for food, marinated the meat in wine and herbs - accidentally creating a signature dish that survived 1,500 years.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Osteria al Duca, Osteria da Morandin (cheap local spot), Trattoria Arco dei Gavi (rustic 20-seat neighborhood gem)

hero_dishes.name: Tortellini di Valeggio
hero_dishes.description: Delicate pasta parcels known as 'lover's knots' made with paper-thin dough, traditionally filled with meat or cheese
hero_dishes.origin_story: From the nearby town of Valeggio sul Mincio, these tortellini are shaped like knots as a romantic symbol. Legend says they were created for a wedding feast along the Mincio River.

signature_drinks.name: Amarone della Valpolicella
signature_drinks.description: Full-bodied red wine made from partially dried grapes, creating concentrated flavors of dark cherry, chocolate, and spice
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served at room temperature with rich meat dishes or aged cheeses. Locals debate the best vintages at Antica Bottega del Vino's legendary wine bar, choosing from over 18,000 labels.

signature_drinks.name: Bardolino
signature_drinks.description: Light, fruity red wine from Lake Garda shores, much fresher and more casual than its famous cousin Amarone
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Slightly chilled and enjoyed as a lunch wine or afternoon aperitivo, especially during warm months by the lake

food_culture_notes: Verona's plains grow Vialone Nano rice, a PGI-protected variety perfect for risotto - shorter and fatter than other Italian rice
Horse meat dishes are traditional here, reflecting the city's agricultural history and frugal Lombard heritage
The city sits between rice fields to the south and Valpolicella vineyards to the north, creating unique dual terroir
Polenta is served alongside almost everything - a reflection of Verona's historically poorer agricultural region where corn was a staple

unique_modern: Contemporary art at Galleria d'Arte Moderna
